title: Don't set User-Agent header by default
body: Updated from #540

title: Add `Response::bytes_stream()`
body:
This converts the `Response` into a `Stream` of `Bytes`.

Closes #734

title: Separate default-tls and native-tls features
body:
To allow for the default-tls to change to a different backend by
default, this adds a new `native-tls` optional feature. Any TLS feature
that was only available using native-tls now requires the `native-tls`
feature to be enabled.

title: Replace futures-channel with tokio::sync in blocking client
Re-enable rustls
body: Update of #701 with CI file fixed.

title: Add note about how to use tokio::main in examples
body: Closes #743

title: Remove a few unused public pieces from the cookie module
Refactor Redirect API
body:
Changed the redirect types to be from the `redirect` module:

- `reqwest::RedirectPolicy` is now `reqwest::redirect::Policy`
- `reqwest::RedirectAttempt` is now `reqwest::redirect::Attempt`
- `reqwest::RedirectAction` is now `reqwest::redirect::Action`

Changed behavior of default policy to no longer check for redirect loops
(loops should still be caught eventually by the maximum limit).

Removed the `too_many_redirects` and `loop_detected` methods from
`Action`.

Added `error` to `Action` that can be passed any error type.

Closes #717

title: support url with authority
body: Cherry picking #735

title: support url with authority
body:
Closes #715 
Closes #716

title: remove travis and appveyor CI files
Add GitHub workflow for CI
body: see https://github.com/nickelc/reqwest/runs/338294172

title: Minor edit of basic_auth
body:
Reimplemented RequestBuilder::basic_auth to use Base64Encoder; this prevents
unnecessary intermediate allocations

title: Implement Default for Client, ClientBuilder and Form
Re-enable testing on stable in CI
Prepare v0.10.0-alpha.2
body:
- Add `Request::try_clone()` method.
- Add HTTP2 window size configuration to `ClientBuilder`.
- Add `Body::as_bytes()` method.
- Add `Response::bytes()` method for WASM target.
- Add `RequestBuilder::body()` method for WASM target.
- Change to enable system/environment proxy detection by default.
- Fix checking `HTTP_PROXY` environment variable if it the environment is from a CGI script.
- Fix removal of username/password of parsed proxy URL.
- Fix pinning `async-compression` dependency to last alpha.

title: Add `as_bytes` method to `Body`
body: This fixes #693.

title: Pin async-compression to the last alpha
body: async-compression v0.1.0 was released with futures v0.3.0 as dependency

title: Update documentation to show usage of system proxies
body:
Add several lines that explain the usage of proxies in the current
version. Introduce the familiar HTTP(S)_PROXY syntax so often seen
in http(s) clients.

Closes #685

title: Implement try_clone for async requests
body: Fixes #533

title: Add request body in the form of Bytes
body:
This is definitely a work in progress - I still need to figure out how to write a unit test or example for it. That being said I thought I'd make the PR to get some extra eyes on it perhaps to make sure I'm not doing this entirely wrong! :) 

(eventually addresses https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/655)

title: Update README.md traits to use dynamic library
body: traits object without an explicit 'dyn' are deprecated.

title: wasm: Add bytes method to wasm Response
body:
The `bytes` method was missing from the `Response` object of the wasm32
compilation target.

title: dependencies: upgrade base64 to latest version
Add error to JsValue conversion and example
body:
This PR adds error conversion for reqwest::Error to JsValue so that consumers of the crate can use the `?` operator to propagate reqwest errors. 

The PR also adds an example usage of such an operator loosely based off of the example usage of `fetch` in the `wasm-bindgen` crate.

title: Remove remnants of old typed headers
wasm: translate over response headers
body: Closes #656

title: Remove username and password when parsing proxies
prevent using HTTP_PROXY if detected inside CGI
Enable "system" proxies by default
body:
If no proxies are configured for a client, the environment (system) will
be inspected automatically to set up proxies.

Configuring a `Proxy` on a client or calling `no_proxy` will disable the
use of the automatic system proxy.

Closes #403

title: Replace uuid dependency with tiny internal RNG
body: Removes about 10 dependencies, and we don't need a strong RNG just to generate multipart boundaries.

body: This removes futures v0.1.29 .

body:
Log a warning instead.

cc #541

Send user-agent in proxy tunnel requests

title: Put Stream APIs behind unstable-stream feature
Update CI to run on rust beta
Make json an optional feature (default off)

title: Rewrite tests with a hyper server instead of raw TCP
body:
This makes the tests much less brittle, by not depending on the exact
order of the HTTP headers, nor always requiring to check for every
single header.

title: Prune the tokio dependencies
body: tokio crate is now only needed for `blocking` and the tests.

title: Make gzip an optional feature (default off)
body: Part of #614

title: Make futures-channel dependency of blocking API
Make the blocking API an optional feature (default off)
Make cookies an optional feature (default off)
body: Part of #614

title: Redesign `Error` type
body:
- The `Error`'s kind is a now a set of variants depending on the context
  of when an error could occur.
- If another error was the cause, it is now always the `source`.

Along with the `is_*` methods, this should help in understanding *when*
a certain error occurred. For example, an error setting the TLS
certificates will return a builder error, with the TLS error as the
source. This should help differentiate from a TLS error that happens
when connecting to a server.

It also makes the internal code less dependent on all the exact
dependencies that can be enabled or disabled.

Closes #628

title: Fixed incorrect description of ClientBuilder::gzip
body: "inflate" actually means decompress in the context of DEFLATE. "deflate" reduces the size of something, i.e. compression, and inflate is the opposite, i.e. decompression.

title: Prune the futures dependencies
body:
futures-core, futures-util and futures-channel for the blocking client.

closes: #621

title: Pin to a nightly rustc
body: `nightly-2019-09-10` includes a regression around borrows when using `async`/`await`.

title: WASM Support
body:
This starts adding wasm32 support to reqwest. Many things don't yet work in it. But the part that is there are least compiles!

Status:

- [x] request method
- [x] request URL
- [x] request headers
- [ ] request body
- [x] fetch response
- [x] response status code
- [ ] response headers
- [x] response body as text
- [ ] response body as bytes
- [ ] CI: somehow run some tests

cc #288

title: Refine async API
body:
- Converted `Response::text` and `Response::json` to `async fn`
- Added `Response::bytes` async fn as a counterpat to `text`.
- Added `Response::chunk` async fn to stream chunks of the response body.
- Added `From<Response> for Body` to allow piping a response as a request body.
- Removed `Decoder` from public API
- Removed body accessor methods from `Response`
- Removed `Chunk` type, replaced with `bytes::Bytes`.
- Removed public `impl Stream for Body`.

title: Make the async Client default
body:
The previously default Client is moved to `reqwest::blocking`, while the
async client becomes the main API.

Closes #622

title: Re-enable rustls feature
body: Closes #619

title: Update to async/await
body:
This updates reqwest from futures 0.1 to `std::future::Future`, and uses `async`/`await` syntax. This is a rebase and update of https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/592

Some features had to be temporarily disabled until the related dependencies upgrade as well:

- rustls-tls
- trust-dns
- socks

Closes #565

title: Fix doc links
body:
Compiling the documentation caused some warnings;
```
warning: `[Form]` cannot be resolved, ignoring it...
 --> src/multipart.rs:3:54
  |
3 | //! To send a `multipart/form-data` body, a [`Form`](Form) is built up, adding
  |                                                      ^^^^ cannot be resolved, ignoring
  |
  = note: `#[warn(intra_doc_link_resolution_failure)]` on by default
  = help: to escape `[` and `]` characters, just add '\' before them like `\[` or `\]`

warning: `[Part]` cannot be resolved, ignoring it...
 --> src/multipart.rs:4:35
  |
4 | //! fields or customized [`Part`](Part)s, and then calling the
  |                                   ^^^^ cannot be resolved, ignoring
  |
  = help: to escape `[` and `]` characters, just add '\' before them like `\[` or `\]`

    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 45.34s
```

title: document socks proxy
body: closes #598

title: Upgrade to url v2.0
body:
This is dependent on upgrading quite a few other crates in the ecosystem:

PR | Merged | Released
-|-|-
~https://github.com/SergioBenitez/cookie-rs/pull/122~ | ~✓~ | 
 https://github.com/pfernie/cookie_store/pull/8 | ✓ | ✓
https://github.com/nox/serde_urlencoded/pull/59 | ✓ | ✓
rushmorem/publicsuffix#19 | ✓ | ✓

For the moment I've used a Cargo.toml patch block to point at those PRs. We'll need to get actual releases of those dependencies before we can merge this, but wanted to open the PR in the meantime.

Fix #582.
